subtitleNullable: Multi Modality MRI images for segmentation of low and high grade gliomas
descriptionNullable:
# About This Dataset
> With a **survival rate of 5%** glioblastomas are a modern day life sentence. Glioblastomas, also known as high grade gliomas are a type of aggressive brain tumors. With that in mind, the Multimodal Brain Tumor Image Segmentation Benchmark (BraTS) is a challenge focused on brain tumor segmentation.
This dataset, from the 2018, 2019 and 2020 challenges, contains data on four modalities of MRI images as well as patient survival data and expert segmentations. The modalities are:
- T1
- T1w
- T2
- T2 FLAIR

# How to use this dataset
> - Create a brain tumor segmentation model.
- Create a tumor grading classification model
- Create a regression model predict the survival of a patient
- Your kernel can be featured here!
- [More datasets](https://www.kaggle.com/andrewmvd/datasets)



# Acknowledgements
If you use this dataset in your research, please credit the authors
> ### Citation
[1] B. H. Menze, A. Jakab, S. Bauer, J. Kalpathy-Cramer, K. Farahani, J. Kirby, et al. "The Multimodal Brain Tumor Image Segmentation Benchmark (BRATS)", IEEE Transactions on Medical Imaging 34(10), 1993-2024 (2015) DOI: 10.1109/TMI.2014.2377694

> [2] S. Bakas, H. Akbari, A. Sotiras, M. Bilello, M. Rozycki, J.S. Kirby, et al., "Advancing The Cancer Genome Atlas glioma MRI collections with expert segmentation labels and radiomic features", Nature Scientific Data, 4:170117 (2017) DOI: 10.1038/sdata.2017.117

> [3] S. Bakas, M. Reyes, A. Jakab, S. Bauer, M. Rempfler, A. Crimi, et al., "Identifying the Best Machine Learning Algorithms for Brain Tumor Segmentation, Progression Assessment, and Overall Survival Prediction in the BRATS Challenge", arXiv preprint arXiv:1811.02629 (2018)


## License
> License was not specified at the source, yet a citation for three above articles was requested upon usage. Please credit the authors, as it values their efforts.

## Splash Image
> Image by Решила Вонасаx available on [flickr](https://www.flickr.com/photos/ideali/2173519079/).
